py_sim.dynamics.unicycle module¶

unicycle.py: Defines types, functions, and classes for the dynamics of a unicycle robot

class py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.UnicycleParams(v_max: float = inf, w_max: float = inf)¶

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.arc_control(time: float, state: UnicycleStateProtocol, dyn_params: UnicycleParams, cont_params: ArcParams) → UnicycleControl¶

Implements the control for a circular arc

Parameters:

  • time – clock time

  • state – vehicle state

  • dyn_params – The parameters for the dynamics

  • cont_params – The paramters for the control law

Returns:

Commanded velocities

Return type:

UnicycleControl

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.desired_vector_follow_velocities(state: UnicycleStateProtocol, vec: TwoDimArray, params: UniVelVecParamsProto) → tuple[float, float]¶

Calculates desired translational and rotational velocities to follow a vector field

Parameters:

  • time – The time for which the control is being calculated

  • state – The state of the unicycle

  • vec – The vector to be followed

  • params – Parameters defining the control

Returns:

returns (vd, wd) where vd is desired translational velocity and wd is the desired rotational velocity

Return type:

tuple[float, float]

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.dynamics(state: UnicycleStateProtocol, control: UnicyleControlProtocol, params: UnicycleParams) → UnicycleState¶

Calculates the dynamics of the unicycle.

Note that even though a “UnicycleState” is returned, that actually corresponds to the time derivative

d/dt x = v cos(psi) d/dt y = v sin(spi) d/dt psi = w

Parameters:

  • state – The current state of the vehicle

  • control – The current input of the vehicle

Returns:

The resulting state time derivative

Return type:

UnicycleState

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.nonlinear_vector_field_control(time: float, state: UnicycleStateProtocol, vec: TwoDimArray, dyn_params: UnicycleParams, cont_params: UniNonlinearVecParams) → UnicycleControl¶

velocity_vector_field_control will calculate the desired control to follow a vector field with the following inputs:

Parameters:

  • time – The time for which the control is being calculated

  • state – The state of the unicycle

  • vec – The vector to be followed

  • dyn_params – The parameters for the dynamics

  • cont_params – The paramters for the control law

Returns:

The commanded translational and rotational velocity

Return type:

UnicycleControl

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.solution(init: UnicycleStateProtocol, control: UnicyleControlProtocol, delta_t: float) → UnicycleState¶

Calculates the resulting solution of the unicycle given an initial state and a control that is held constant over a time interval.

Parameters:

  • init – Initial state of the vehicle

  • control – Control input that is assumed constant over the time interval

  • delta_t – The time interval in question

Returns:

The state of the unicycle at the end of the delta_t horizon

Return type:

UnicycleState

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.solution_trajectory(init: UnicycleStateProtocol, control: UnicyleControlProtocol, ds: float, tf: float) → tuple[list[float], list[float]]¶

Calculates the trajectory of the unicycle given an initial state and a control that is held constant over a time interval.

Parameters:

  • init – Initial state of the vehicle

  • control – Control input that is assumed constant over the time interval

  • ds – The resolution in meters of the desired state spacing

  • tf – The final time value of execution

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.velocity_control(time: float, state: UnicycleStateProtocol, vd: float, wd: float) → UnicycleControl¶

Implements a velocity control for the unicycle, which is simply copying the desired inputs

Parameters:

  • time – clock time (not used)

  • state – vehicle state (not used)

  • vd – Desired translational velocity

  • wd – Desired rotational velocity

Returns:

Commanded velocities

Return type:

UnicycleControl

py_sim.dynamics.unicycle.velocity_vector_field_control(time: float, state: UnicycleStateProtocol, vec: TwoDimArray, dyn_params: UnicycleParams, cont_params: UniVelVecParamsProto) → UnicycleControl¶

velocity_vector_field_control will calculate the desired control to follow a vector field with the following inputs:

Parameters:

  • time – The time for which the control is being calculated

  • state – The state of the unicycle

  • vec – The vector to be followed

  • dyn_params – The parameters for the dynamics

  • cont_params – The paramters for the control law

Returns:

The commanded translational and rotational velocity

Return type:

UnicycleControl
